content.description: GALAXEV is a library of evolutionary stellar population synthesis models computed using the new isochrone synthesis code of Bruzual &Charlot (2003). This code allows one to computes the spectral evolution of stellar populations in wide ranges of ages and metallicities at a resolution of 3 ? across the whole wavelength range from 3200 ? to 9500 ?, and at lower resolution outside this range.

parameterDefinition.name: IMF
parameterDefinition.description: Initial Mass Function for model

parameterDefinition.name: Resolution
parameterDefinition.description: Low (lr) or High (hr) spectral resolution of output

parameterDefinition.name: Track model
parameterDefinition.description: Model used for stellar population evolutionary tracks. Please also choose appropriate metallicity

parameterDefinition.name: Padova1994 metallicity
parameterDefinition.description: Metallicity for Padova1994 tracks. 0.02 is solar

parameterDefinition.name: Padova2000 metallicity
parameterDefinition.description: Metallicity for Padova2000 tracks. 0.019 is solar

parameterDefinition.name: Dust?
parameterDefinition.description: Include dust in models? If Yes please enter optical depth parameters

parameterDefinition.name: Dust tau_v
parameterDefinition.description: Total effective attenuation optical depth

parameterDefinition.name: Dust mu
parameterDefinition.description: Fraction of tau_v arising from the ambient ISM

parameterDefinition.name: SFR type
parameterDefinition.description: Star formation rate model. SSP is one instantaneous burst; for other options please see descriptions for parameter selections below

parameterDefinition.name: Exponential SFR Tau
parameterDefinition.description: e-folding timescale of exponentially declining star formation

parameterDefinition.name: Exponential SFR gas recycle?
parameterDefinition.description: Recycle gas ejected by stars in exponentially declining star formation? If Yes please also enter epsilon

parameterDefinition.name: Exponential SFR gas recycle epsilon
parameterDefinition.description: Fraction of gas recycled: epsilon ]0,1]. <0 implies wind; >1 implies infall.

parameterDefinition.name: Exponential SFR Tcut
parameterDefinition.description: Set SFR back to zero at time Tcut

parameterDefinition.name: singleburst SFR tau
parameterDefinition.description: Single burst of star formation, duration tau

parameterDefinition.name: Constant SFR
parameterDefinition.description: Star formation rate for constant SFR

parameterDefinition.name: Constant SFR Tcut
parameterDefinition.description: Set SFR back to zero at time Tcut

parameterDefinition.name: Delayed SFR tau
parameterDefinition.description: SFR reaches maximum at time tau

parameterDefinition.name: Delayed SFR Tcut
parameterDefinition.description: Set SFR back to zero at time Tcut

parameterDefinition.name: Linearly decreasing SFR tau
parameterDefinition.description: SFR is 0 at time tau

parameterDefinition.name: Linearly decreasing SFR Tcut
parameterDefinition.description: Set SFR back to zero at time Tcut

parameterDefinition.name: Lower wavelength W1
parameterDefinition.description: Lower limit to wavelength range of output spectra W0 [91,1.600E+06]

parameterDefinition.name: Upper wavelength W2
parameterDefinition.description: Upper limit to wavelength range of output spectra W0 [91,1.600E+06]

parameterDefinition.name: Flux axis units
parameterDefinition.description: Flux axis of output is Flambda in Msun/Angstrom or Fnu in Msun/Hz

parameterDefinition.name: Normalisation
parameterDefinition.description: Normalise output spectrum? If so, please see options for parameter selection below

parameterDefinition.name: WAVE_F0
parameterDefinition.description: Normalise spectrum to luminosity F0 (at wavelength W0)

parameterDefinition.name: WAVE_W0
parameterDefinition.description: Normalise spectrum (to luminosity F0) at wavelength W0

parameterDefinition.name: Fz_F0
parameterDefinition.description: Normalise spectrum to luminosity F0 (for a source at redshift z in FILTER)

parameterDefinition.name: Fz_z
parameterDefinition.description: Normalise spectrum (to luminosity F0) for a source at redshift z (in FILTER)

parameterDefinition.name: Fz_FILTER
parameterDefinition.description: Filter in which source is observed, B+B = Bessel & Brett, M+S = Matthews & Sandage, P200IR = Palomar 200 IR detectors, S+S = Sandage & Smith, W+C = Wainscoat and Cowie see **give link** for more information/references

parameterDefinition.name: Ages
parameterDefinition.description: Up to 24 comma-separated ages (up to 20 Gy) at which to produce output

parameterDefinition.name: Cosmological Evolution?
parameterDefinition.description: Produce cosmological evolution models? If Yes, please fill in additional parameters

parameterDefinition.name: H0
parameterDefinition.description: Value for Hubble constant if cosmological evolution was requested

parameterDefinition.name: Omega
parameterDefinition.description: Cosmological parameter

parameterDefinition.name: Omega_lambda
parameterDefinition.description: Cosmological parameter

parameterDefinition.name: Galaxy Age
parameterDefinition.description: Present age of galaxy

parameterDefinition.name: Filter 1
parameterDefinition.description: First filter for output. B+B = Bessel & Brett, M+S = Matthews & Sandage, P200IR = Palomar 200 IR detectors, S+S = Sandage & Smith, W+C = Wainscoat and Cowie see **give link** for more information/references

parameterDefinition.name: Filter 2
parameterDefinition.description: Second filter for output. B+B = Bessel & Brett, M+S = Matthews & Sandage, P200IR = Palomar 200 IR detectors, S+S = Sandage & Smith, W+C = Wainscoat and Cowie see **give link** for more information/references

parameterDefinition.name: AB Magnitudes
parameterDefinition.description: AB magnitudes in SDSS filters as function of galaxy Age

parameterDefinition.name: Vega Colours
parameterDefinition.description: mags and colors (Vega) as function of galaxy Age in standard filters

parameterDefinition.name: Other Magnitudes
parameterDefinition.description: mags and colours with more filter sets

parameterDefinition.name: Spectra at Ages
parameterDefinition.description: Spectra (lambda & fluxes at chosen ages).

parameterDefinition.name: Magnitudes Filter 1
parameterDefinition.description: Magnitude redshift evolution in FILTER1

parameterDefinition.name: Magnitudes Filter 2
parameterDefinition.description: Magnitude redshift evolution in FILTER2
